outliers_handler module

class metabotk.outliers_handler.OutlierHandler

Bases: object

Class for detecting outliers using the Interquartile Range (IQR) method.

count_outliers(data_frame, threshold, axis=0)

Count number of outlier values in each row or column of a dataframe.

Parameters: - data_frame: pandas DataFrame containing only numeric values - threshold: a factor that determines the range from the IQR - axis: {0 or ‘index’, apply to each column, 1 or ‘columns’, apply to each row}, default 0

Returns: - pandas Series with the row/column index and the number of outliers

detect_outliers(data, threshold)

Detect outlier values in a single-column numerical array.

Parameters: - data: single-column numerical array - threshold: a factor that determines the range from the IQR

Returns: - Boolean array indicating outliers (True) and non-outliers (False)

get_outliers_matrix(data_frame, threshold, axis=0)

Get a matrix indicating outliers in each row or column of a dataframe.

Parameters: - data_frame: pandas DataFrame containing only numeric values - threshold: a factor that determines the range from the IQR - axis: {0 or ‘index’, apply to each column, 1 or ‘columns’, apply to each row}, default 0

Returns: - pandas DataFrame indicating outliers (True) and non-outliers (False)

remove_outliers(data_frame, threshold, axis=0)

Replace outlier values with NAs in a dataframe, column-wise or row-wise.

Parameters: - data_frame: pandas DataFrame containing only numeric values - threshold: a factor that determines the range from the IQR - axis: {0 or ‘index’, apply to each column, 1 or ‘columns’, apply to each row}, default 0

Returns: - pandas DataFrame where the outlier values are replaced by NAs
